content.description: The yield of a certain chemical reaction is believed to be related to temperature. A study collected the yield from 15 such reactions selected at random to test the belief and produced the following results.
content.question: Variable Estimate Intercept 1 15.5 2.96 Temp 1 0.05 0.017 <math alttext="R s q equals 0.73" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-sq</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.73</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Let <math alttext="beta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> represent the slope of the population regression line used to predict the yield of the reaction from the temperature. A <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a slope of a regression line was conducted for the following hypotheses. <math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>H</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>H</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>Which of the following is the appropriate test statistic for the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 15.5 over 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 15.5 over 0.73" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>15.5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.73</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 0.05 over 15.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15.5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 0.05 over 0.73" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.73</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 0.05 over 0.017" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.017</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction 0.05 over 0.017" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.017</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
